TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national born in DATE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , PERSON .

The applicant met M , a NORP citizen , in GPE in DATE . In DATE their first daughter was born in GPE . The applicant went to GPE in DATE and married M. As he had been sentenced to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment and expulsion by a NORP court in DATE , his application for a residence permit in GPE was refused , however . He was expelled in DATE . M and the daughter followed the applicant to GPE but returned to GPE DATE . Later , the applicant was granted a visa to enter GPE . He arrived in DATE . As he was unable to find employment in GPE , the family decided to move to GPE . M was later granted a permanent residence permit in that country .

The family arrived in GPE in DATE . After the applicant had been refused a residence permit , he returned to GPE on DATE and applied anew for a residence permit . M and the daughter joined him in GPE for DATE in DATE . In DATE the applicant was granted a permit to reside in GPE for DATE , and so the family returned to GPE . The applicant ’s permit was renewed for DATE at a time until he was granted a permanent residence permit in DATE . In DATE the applicant ’s and M ’s son was born . In DATE they had a second daughter .

The applicant had started using hash and in DATE he sought treatment for his drug problems . In DATE the applicant and M were detained on remand , suspected of narcotics offences . On DATE ORG ( tingsrätten ) of GPE convicted the couple - and a few co - accused - of the offences and sentenced them to imprisonment , the applicant for DATE and M for DATE . Upon appeal , ORG ( PERSON hovrätt ) acquitted the applicant of some of the charges . However , by a judgment of CARDINAL DATE he was found guilty of an aggravated narcotics offence involving QUANTITY of heroin and of smuggling of goods . He was sentenced to DATE in prison . In addition , the court ordered his expulsion from GPE in accordance with LAW , LAW ( Utlänningslagen , CARDINAL ) and issued a prohibition on his return . Having regard to his family connections to GPE , this prohibition was limited to DATE , i.e. until DATE . M ’s involvement in the offence was considered to be less serious , and her sentence was accordingly reduced to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . ORG later refused leave to appeal against ORG judgment .
In DATE the applicant requested the Government to exercise its power under LAW , LAW of LAW to annul the expulsion order . By a decision of DATE the ORG rejected the request .

On DATE the applicant was released on probation and expelled to GPE . Upon arrival he was allegedly arrested and detained for DATE . M and the CARDINAL children visited the applicant in GPE DATE and DATE .
On DATE the ORG rejected a further request for an annulment of the expulsion order .
